chunk_metadata.created_by: Enhanced Markdown Chunker with Comprehensive Context

works.Name: Overture in C major
works.Notes: First performed by Königsstädter Orchestra under Lecerf; described as sonata-form with slow introduction
works.Long Description: Striking for its extravagant invention; effectively scored combining thematic coherence with wide range of color and expression; suitable for amateur and professional orchestras
works.Short Description: Sonata-form overture with slow introduction and virtuosic string writing

works.Name: Das Jahr (orchestrated)
works.Notes: Orchestrated without piano by Martin Torp; original piano cycle clearly conceived orchestrally
works.Scoring: 2 flutes (2nd doubling piccolo), 2 oboes (2nd doubling English horn), 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons, 2 horns, strings
works.Long Description: Orchestration of Fanny Hensel's piano cycle; movements: März (4'), Juni (3'), Oktober (3'30), Nachspiel (0'50)
works.Short Description: Orchestrated piano cycle in four movements

works.Name: Symphony No. 3 in C major
works.Notes: Also known as 'Sinfonie Militaire'; edited by Craig Doolin
works.Scoring: 2 flutes (2nd doubling piccolo), 2 oboes, 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons, 2 horns, 2 trumpets, 3 trombones, timpani, percussion, strings
works.Long Description: Four movements: I. Adagio - Allegro con brio, II. Un poco Adagio, III. Scherzo. Allegro, IV. Finale Militaire: Adagio - Allegro vivace; combines Viennese classic style with sudden tonal shifts

works.Name: Symphony No. 4 in B minor
works.Notes: Most celebrated in Mayer's time but considered lost; reconstructed by Stefan Malzew from four-hand piano version
works.Scoring: 2 flutes, 2 oboes, 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons, 3 horns, 2 trumpets, 3 trombones, timpani, strings
works.Long Description: Four movements: I. Allegro appassionato, II. Adagio, III. Allegro, IV. Presto Lento; reconstructed from surviving piano version

works.Name: Symphony No. 5 in F minor
works.Notes: Also numbered as Symphony No. 7; edited by Cornelia Bartsch/Cordula Heymann-Wentzel
works.Scoring: 2 flutes, 2 oboes, 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons, 4 horns, 2 trumpets, 1 trombone, timpani, strings
works.Long Description: Four movements: I. Allegro agitato, II. Adagio, III. Scherzo. Allegro vivace, IV. Finale. Allegro vivace; praised in 1850 for originality and independence despite Beethoven reminiscences
works.Short Description: Fifth symphony showing originality and experimental spirit

works.Name: Concert Overture
works.Notes: First work for large orchestra; dedicated to Grand Duke Friedrich and Duchess Luise of Baden; premiered successfully in Baden-Baden
works.Long Description: Le Beau's first orchestral work, followed by Fantasy for piano and orchestra op. 25, Piano Concerto op. 37, Symphony op. 41, Symphonic Poem op. 43
works.Short Description: First large-scale orchestral work by self-taught composer

works.Name: Suite en forme de valses
works.Notes: Edited by Christine Géliot; consists of three waltz movements
works.Scoring: 1 flute, 1 oboe, 2 clarinets, 1 bassoon, 2 horns, timpani, strings
works.Long Description: Three-movement waltz suite: Ballabile op. 37/3 (2'), Interlude et Valse lente op. 38/3 (4'), Scherzo-Valse op. 35/Ξ (2')

chunk_info.processing_notes: Extracted 7 complete orchestral works from Romantic women composers including symphonies, overtures and suites with full instrumentation and publication details
